image.altText: A man speaks into a microphone at a press conference. He has a bald head and wears a patterned shirt.

props.synopsis: The NT Administrator appears to have expressed support for federal Labor in the ABC’s Your Say election call-out, despite holding a "non-partisan" and "publicly neutral" role as a Crown representative.

title.children: NT's Crown representative appears to back Labor ahead of election

image.altText: Woman speaks in parliament

props.synopsis: The NT parliament has passed new bail laws on urgency after the fatal stabbing of a Darwin supermarket owner, as the government flags an overhaul of youth justice laws.

title.children: NT passes urgent bail laws as government flags youth justice overhaul

image.altText: People attend the voting centre in Mitchell Street during the NT council elections. Image taken August 26, 2017.

props.synopsis: The Local Government Association of the Northern Territory has criticised a proposal to change how council mayors are elected in some jurisdictions.

title.children: Outcry over NT proposal to strip voters of right to elect local mayors

image.altText: Shuqin Li

props.synopsis: Members of Darwin's Chinese community are calling for federal Labor and the Coalition to reconsider their election promises to take back the lease of the Darwin Port.

title.children: Chinese community urges rethink on major parties' Darwin Port plans

image.altText: A digital drawing of Erin Patterson wearing a pink shirt

props.synopsis: A Supreme Court jury hears opening submissions in the trial of Victorian woman Erin Patterson, who is accused of using a poisoned meal to murder three relatives. Follow all the updates in our live blog.

title.children: Erin Patterson's lawyer tells jury mushroom poisoning deaths were 'a terrible accident'

image.altText: Political candidates clapping in front of a crowd.

props.synopsis: The Greens have outlined an extensive policy wishlist in the hope they will wield the balance of power in a Labor minority government. So what are their key priorities?

title.children: Here's what the Greens will prioritise in a minority Labor government

image.altText: Purple sign reads "voting centre"

props.synopsis: Applications for postal votes close tonight at 6pm but early voters are wasting no time having their say.

title.children: More than 4 million Australians have already voted. Major political parties take note

image.altText: Two men sitting on chairs in a church

props.synopsis: Donald Trump has made big promises on Russia's war in Ukraine but he's becoming an impatient broker.

title.children: After meeting with Trump, Zelenskyy once again chose his words carefully

image.altText: Donald Trump smiles as a crowd holds supportive signs behind him.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump has used a campaign-style public rally to rage against "fake polls" that show his approval ratings falling as he chalks up 100 days back in office.

title.children: 'Non-stop nightmare': Away from Trump's cheery rally, Americans voice fears

image.altText: Heavy machinery demolishing a partially damaged house as men watch on.

props.synopsis: The Myanmar military has been accused of hoarding life-saving relief while survivors endure soaring heat, disease, and displacement in earthquake-shattered Myanmar.

title.children: One month after huge quake, Myanmar faces double crisis

image.altText: Two men wearing glasses and suits behind the backdrop of the world map.

props.synopsis: The next federal government faces a world with drastic US policy changes, trade disputes, and ongoing wars in Europe and the Middle East. The ABC asked experts what the next Australian prime minister needs to address first to ensure the country is stable, safe and successful.

title.children: Australia faces 'lonelier' world with rules-based order crumbling

image.altText: Pauline Hanson having her selfie taken with a young man.

props.synopsis: In a last-minute campaign dash to the west, Pauline Hanson dropped in on the Nullarbor Muster to speak to voters days out from the federal election.

title.children: 'Forgotten' voters flock to Pauline Hanson amid Nullarbor visit

image.altText: A policeman knocks on a front door while his partner checks a clipboard

props.synopsis: Queensland's new domestic violence laws will give police more power than ever before, but not everyone is convinced they'll protect those most at risk.

title.children: 'Landmark' domestic violence reforms spark concern from stakeholders

image.altText: Two copies of the Bake with Brooki cookbook.

props.synopsis: Can you own a recipe? And what are the protocols if you take inspiration from another cookbook author's work?

title.children: Brooki Bakehouse has been accused of plagiarising recipes. But can you own one?

image.altText: Kane Cornes

props.synopsis: The Kangaroos confirm they have banned Channel 7 pundit Kane Cornes from talking to players and coaches over "vindictive attacks" aimed at North Melbourne stars.

title.children: 'Bullying behaviour': Clarkson and Kangaroos ban Channel 7 pundit from interviews

image.altText: a card that reads "with the compliments of HRH The Duchess of Sussex" on it

props.synopsis: The use of the title HRH on a card the duchess sent to a friend has set off British tabloids, but the royal couple say the haven't broken any agreements

title.children: Three letters on a card from the Duchess of Sussex sparks debate about her royal title

image.altText: Gruen Nation panellists Toby Raplh, Todd Sampson, Wil Anderson, Annie O'Rourke, Russel Howcroft and Hannah Ferguson.

props.synopsis: From corflutes on street corners to 'brain rot' memes on social media, political parties are pulling out all of the stops in an attempt to snag your vote this election. Gruen's panel of advertising brains break down the tricks from the (campaign) trail.

title.children: Gruen Nation unpacks the tricks of the trade from election ad campaigns

image.altText: Woman in glasses smiles.

props.synopsis: Prosecutors say a DV murderer, who used a 30cm kitchen knife to repeatedly stab his former partner, blames her for his actions in an apology letter read at his sentencing.

title.children: Murderer who stabbed ex-partner 78 times accused of 'victim blaming'

image.altText: Ally Luppino, who is wearing a blue dress and long dark hair, poses for a photo in a chair, in a smart corporate space

props.synopsis: Both major party campaigns have teams of advancers, staying one step ahead of their leader and preparing the media moments for the days ahead — all while trying to remain in the shadows.

title.children: Election 'roadies' know a single photo can derail a campaign day or worse

image.altText: nsw ambulances and police outside the westfield shopping centre at bondi junction after a mass stabbing event

props.synopsis: A critical care paramedic who responded to the Bondi Junction stabbing says he felt "frustrated" and "inadequate" after a directive for ambulance crews to stay outside the Westfield shopping centre.

title.children: 'Not good enough': Paramedic frustrated by delay in reaching Bondi victims

image.altText: Police sniffer dog at Sydney Big Day Out

props.synopsis: Sniffer dogs will patrol another Sydney music festival where pill testing is set to be trialled this weekend, with the Minns government so far refusing to act on a key recommendation of its drug summit.

title.children: Key drug summit advice to be ignored again at major Sydney festival

image.altText: A man stands with his arms crossed in front of a house next to an empty lot.

props.synopsis: The major parties have decided on a solution to Australia's housing crisis: build more homes. But some of the country's newest suburbs suggest it's not as straightforward as it seems.

title.children: 'What I feel is left out': The growing pains of Australia's newest suburbs

image.altText: shac teal

props.synopsis: The Climate 200 founder lit a fire that could clear a path for independents to decide the next government. They say his influence ends there.

title.children: Holmes à Court fuels movement that denies he will have seat at table

image.altText: Tarryn Aiken running to the left of the field, preparing to pass to her left, looking for a support player

props.synopsis: Queensland playmaker Tarryn Aiken is expected to be an integral part of the Maroons' attack in the Women's State of Origin series.

title.children: Aiken strengthens Maroons' attacking one-two punch with Ali

image.altText: Donald Trump speaks while standing outside.

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump acknowledges Australia's efforts to talk to him about trade and says he intends to speak to the Australian prime minister about the issue.

title.children: PM shrugs off Trump's 'throwaway comment' on Australia's efforts to call

image.altText: Peter Dutton

props.synopsis: Looking back, the opposition leader might ruefully reflect that a savage aged care scare campaign might have come in handy right about now.

title.children: There's a reason Dutton can't resort to a scare campaign with older Australians

image.altText: An image of Qiong Yan, who has brown hair and a fringe.

props.synopsis: The man accused of murdering a woman, and keeping her body in a toolbox at his Brisbane apartment for almost a year, told police he was "tired of pretending" to be her, a Supreme Court trial has heard.

title.children: Murder accused told police he was 'tired of pretending' to be his alleged victim

image.altText: A black-and-white photo of Adolf Hitler standing in uniform beside Leni Riefenstahl

props.synopsis: Leni Riefenstahl made some of the Nazis' most notorious propaganda films, but denied any knowledge of the Holocaust until the day she died. This documentary tries to find the truth, and help us understand the rise of fascism today.

title.children: This woman made films for Hitler, but denied knowing about the Holocaust

image.altText: Stephanie Gilmore paddling into the surf at the Gold Coast, on her surf board

props.synopsis: Eight-time world champion Stephanie Gilmore will return to the World Surf League for a cameo at the Gold Coast Pro after almost two years away from competition.

title.children: Eight-time world champion Gilmore to make long-awaited return

image.altText: A man near a shark in shallow water.

props.synopsis: A shark has been returned to the ocean after it became stuck in shallow waters off a South Australian beach.

title.children: Trio free shark stuck in shallow waters

image.altText: A smiling man with dark hair kneels next a sandy-coloured dog in a yard.

props.synopsis: A Queensland man has failed in his bid to have a hefty penalty for walking his dog without a leash reduced.

title.children: Owner of obedient, partially blind dog shocked by $806 fine

image.altText: close up image of woman in underwear

props.synopsis: Both thrush and bacterial vaginosis (BV) are common and easily treatable, but because there is less awareness around BV, people may be reaching for the wrong treatment option.

title.children: 'Common confusion': The difference between thrush and bacterial vaginosis

props.synopsis: Listeners have asked us to explain the childcare policies on offer at this election. There’s a crisis in the quality of care, with Four Corners recently revealing alarming cases of mistreatment and even abuse of children.

title.children: Your questions: Which party will fix childcare?
